availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hamlet Winn Chiles (Boyle County, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Boyle County Kentucky resident. Kentucky native. Son of John G. Chiles and Elizabeth Chiles. Married to Edward ("Eddy") Anna Payne Chiles. Father of John G. Chiles, Georgia Chiles and Arris Chiles. Clerk in Fayette County, Kentucky in 1850. Resident of Boyle County, Kentucky in 1860. Registered for the Union Army draft in Lexington, Kentucky in July 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 199.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, p. 883.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's
Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), City of Lexington, KY, July 1863, p. 111 of microfilm, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7019177, Woodford County Deaths, File #10432.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7016224, Bourbon County Deaths, File #31446.
